data.name: ResourceFlowDirection
data.comment: Controls the FlowDirection for all elements in the RootFrame. Set to the traditional direction of this resource file's language

data.name: ResourceLanguage
data.comment: Controls the Language and ensures that the font for all elements in the RootFrame aligns with the app's language. Set to the language code of this resource file's language.

data.value: Obd is not allowed to use

data.value: Device out of range, tap to refresh

data.name: AppEndDescription
data.value: To close an applicationpress the back button again. The recording will be terminated.

data.name: TapOnScreenToStopRecording
data.value: Tap on screen to stop recording

data.name: SendByEmailBody
data.value: There is link for download your backuped data.{E}Your backup id is {0}{E}Click on {1} to start download.

data.name: DownloadBackupHelp
data.value: Click here to download bacup from your storage

data.name: BackupApplyDescription
data.value: Do you really wan to load backup from cloud storage? This action is not reversable!

data.name: BackupDescription
data.value: When selecting automatic backups, backup only save the main configuration file with settings and data. Videos and photos are not automatically included in the backup and you must manually back up it . That's possible only on WiFi network. Backup video files can take a long time!

data.name: ErrorDescription
data.value: Sorry, but the application has encountered an unexpected error. Please help me improve the application and send me an email with an error message after next start. The application will be closed now.

data.name: ReportDescription
data.value: Last termination of application caused by error. Want to help me improve an application and report a bug?

data.name: Tutorial_BackupFileMenu_Description
data.value: There are four important buttons in the menu. 1) Use this button to back up the main file 2) If the backup is created, you can refer to it in the browser (and store) or 3) let it send the email. If you have a backup on cloud storage 4) you can download it by click on this button.

data.name: Tutorial_BackupMenu_Description
data.value: There are three important buttons in the side menu. These are 1) a general backup, which backs up the main data file, 2) backup images and 3) backup videos. If you select automatic backup after launch, it is only a backup the main data file! Videos and pictures can be backuped only manually. You can see which items have not been backed up in the lists of media.

data.name: Tutorial_Backup_Description
data.value: After clicking on the "Backup" in the settings page, you will see information about the backup. Here you will find the date of the last backup, the backup identifier and settings. 1) Whether you want to do a backup after starting the application and 2) when you want to backup your data, you must login into cloud storage.

data.name: Tutorial_CameraMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the camera menu you will see four buttons in front of you. 1) Start and stop recording, 2) Take a photo, 3) Viewing your saved videos, 4) Viewing your saved photos.

data.name: Tutorial_End_Description
data.value: Can i have close the tutorial? You can rerun this tutorial from more menu.

data.name: Tutorial_FuelMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the menu for refueling, there are appears two buttons and a list of tanking in front of you. 1) Used to record new refueling, 2) To show the average consumption and can be used to switch the display mode, 3) One entry in the list, detail can be viewed by clicking.

data.name: Tutorial_Information
data.value: Please take a few minutes to this tutorial.

data.name: Tutorial_MainScreen_Description_One
data.value: On the main screen you can see the statistics of application's data and after closing by an arrow on the left side you will see the view throught camera and the main application menu.

data.name: Tutorial_MainScreen_Description_Two
data.value: The main menu contains four main buttons. 1) Camera, 2) Refueling, 3) Repairs and 4) Settings and others.

data.name: Tutorial_MoreMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the other menu (three dots), there appears a list of other settings in front of you. 1) Used to enable GPS, 2) Connect the OBD module if there are more, you can select one, 3) Is used to turn drive mode that accepts voice commands, 4) Is used for uploading or sending backup. In this menu are also buttons to set the units, links to social networks and more.

data.name: Tutorial_ObdPage_Description
data.value: If you click on 1) OBD button when device is connected to your mobile, you will see the actual data from the OBD module on display. All data are stored for later visualization and browsing condition of the car.

data.name: Tutorial_RepairMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the menu for repairs and you are switch into context 3) repairs, you will see the button and a list of repairs in front of you . 1) Used to create new repair record, 2) One entry in the list, detail can be viewed by clicking on it.

data.name: Tutorial_ThanksEnd_Description
data.value: The tutorial is over and you can always run the tutorial again from application menu.

data.name: Tutorial_WhatIsIt_Description
data.value: CoPilot is an application that is used to record any information about your car. You can record videos, take photos, keep records of refueling and repairs. When you connect the OBD also collect important data and then view them on desktop device.

data.name: Tile
data.value: Car has average consumption of {0} and underwent {1} repairs.

data.value: You are not logged into any cloud storage service. For proper operation of backups you need to login.

data.name: VideoError_Description
data.value: Error occured when trying open the video file. Try to again.

data.name: Tutorial_MaintenanceMenu_Description
data.value: If you click on the menu for repairs and you are switch into context 3) maintenance, you will see the button and a list of maitenances in front of you . 1) Used to create new maintenance or event record, 2) One entry in the list, detail can be viewed by clicking on it.

data.name: Tutorial_StatsScreen_Description_One
data.value: When you start the application you can see screen with basic statistic information. These are 1) the average fuel consumption, 2) the average speed, 3) the total price paid for fuel, 4) the total price paid for repairs and 5) the number of maintenance tasks (technical, insurance, checking oil, etc. ...). On this screen are also available some information graphs.

data.name: WebInterface_Description
data.value: Enter this url into your web browser on a computer that is connected to the same WiFi network. You will be able to manage your data from user-friendly web applications. NOTE: Applications must be turned on during work in your browser!

data.name: Error
data.value: When loading a page the error occurred. Please reload the page and try to load it again. Check if application CoPilot still running and WiFi network is available.

data.name: Welcome_Chat
data.value: CoPilot is an application that houses all data from your car. You're currently gained a total of {0} of fuel for which you have paid {1} {2}. The total number of refueling to date is {3}. For your car you have paid total {5} {2} for {4} repairs. At the current time, you have planned {6} maintenances. Thanks to the recording of video and taking photos is easy to maintain evidence of accidents or just record video from your roads. You currently have {7} videos and you took a {8} photos.

data.name: Welcome_Motto
data.value: Everything about your car in one place!

data.name: FacebookDescription
data.value: Copilot is an application which allows you to record and visualize all available information about your car. Simply plug in the power and explore!

data.name: GoogleDescription
data.value: Watch the latest photos and contributions from the CoPilot application. There is more than just information on applications development, but also content from other people who use the application.

data.name: MaintenanceType_Filters_Description
data.value: After a while you will need to replace some filters in your engine. Check the mileage and cycle time in the workshop.

data.name: MaintenanceType_Insurance_Description
data.value: Car Insurance ends soon. If you want to cancel the insurance, please do so as soon as possible.

data.name: MaintenanceType_Maintenance_Description
data.value: Engine maintenance is approaching. Check out what maintenance you expect and then go for your mechanic or authorized service center.

data.name: MaintenanceType_Oil_Description
data.value: You need to change the oil in your car engine. Do so as soon as possible, or may cause damage to the engine.

data.name: MaintenanceType_TechnicalInspection_Description
data.value: Approaching the technical inspection of the car. Have the car in your service, and then you let this car for MOT.

data.name: SocialDescription
data.value: Links to social networks. Communicate, Contribute, write your opinions and comments. You can also propose some features that you would suited in the program.

data.name: TwitterDescription
data.value: Communicate with the others, watch the latest posts and suggest new features. Use the hashtag #carcopilot and connect with others.

data.name: YoutubeDescription
data.value: Video Copilot Channel, where you can find various tutorials, instructions, all kinds of tips and tricks and even recorded videos from the camera. All in one place, in one channel.

data.name: ObdDescription
data.value: On-board diagnostics (OBD) is an automotive term referring to a vehicle's self-diagnostic and reporting capability. OBD systems give the vehicle owner or repair technician access to the status of the various vehicle sub-systems. The amount of diagnostic information available via OBD has varied widely since its introduction in the early 1980s' versions of on-board vehicle computers. Early versions of OBD would simply illuminate a malfunction indicator light or "idiot light" if a problem was detected but would not provide any information as to the nature of the problem. Modern OBD implementations use a standardized digital communications port to provide real-time data in addition to a standardized series of diagnostic trouble codes, or DTCs, which allow one to rapidly identify and remedy malfunctions within the vehicle.

data.name: ObdBuy
data.value: What is OBD and where it buy?
